website_summaries.verdict: Space-saving, simple to install, and easy on the bike frame, this pivoting rack is very impressive.
pros: Holds a variety of cycles and can swing left or right to free up more space
We like the stabilizing bracket that fits a variety of tire widths and helps distribute weight evenly
cons: Mounting caps are made of plastic that can chip or break easily
That doesn’t affect the product’s stability though

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not 5-Star great.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Steady Rack. I’m kinda handy, so I cut boards to span between the studs in the wall and hung it from them. It works, I’m 4-star happy. 4 instead of 5 stars because, as in the case if my Fat Rack, that rear tire pivot piece is lame. It barely fits my wife’s 2.4” e-bike tire. Are you reading these reviews Steady Rack??? The rest works great!
customer_reviews.author: Busted Yuppie

customer_reviews.title: great rack, but the instructions are incorrect and the enclosed hardware is absolutely inadequate
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this rack to install in your garage, you may want to skip the instructions with regard to the holes to drill and change the length of the screws. For example, you obviously don't drill 3/8 in holes for 5/16 in screws. However, that is what the instructions state. Further, most drywall in garages in 5/8 in. Therefore, the enclosed 2 in 5/16 in screws will not have the length properly engage the stud. You need 5/16 in 2.5 inch screws. With these changes and similar changes to the screws for the lower tire rest, the rack is great. So the one star is for the instructions and the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: br

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike racks
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One for road bike, one for mountain bike. They're mounted on the wall about 2 feet apart. Very secure, very reliable. I have no worries putting my $3k carbon fiber road bike in this rack. You can swing the bikes left or right to about a 45 degree angle from the wall to save floor space. Installation is straightforward. Mounting them to a wall stud is best. I get compliments from people that see them. "That's neat! Where did you get them?" Steady racks are a little pricey, but they're cheap compared to a damaged bike or car if the rack were to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Larry In SC

customer_reviews.title: Well built and well designed - pay close attention to drill bit sizes
customer_reviews.text: I installed 3 of these racks side by side into wood studs. These are very well built and heavy duty. Installation was simple and I am using them to hold a fairly heavy E-Bike along with a couple standard road bikes. Because they swivel, you can install them at 16" centers and will have plenty of room for each bike. One note - the instructions call for 10mm and 8mm drill bits to install the lag bolts. This is incorrect. Take a close look at the bolts that come with your rack and make sure you choose the correct drill bit size. In my case, using the sizes specified in the instructions would have been too big.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Good As They Say
customer_reviews.text: Very clever engineering that results in extra walking space in your garage. Only funky thing -- and this is so minor that I chose not to deduct any stars -- is that you can't use the bottom tire cleat when you pivot the bike to one side or another. They recommend you place the tire to the side of the cleat before pivoting. Well, if you do that, you're going to leave tire marks on the wall. So I had my guy install 6" x 10" aluminum plates BEHIND the cleat as you see in photo. And that took care of that. (I'm guessing the manufacturer will pick up on this and start adding their own backing plates.)
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver and really well made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new bike and realized space was limited. I don’t have high ceilings, so hoisting it high up wasn’t an option. I looked into ones that hold the bike horizontally flat against the wall, but that took up a lot of usable wall space. I also considered the fixed vertical holders, but the bike simply stuck out way too far. This holder is great because it lets you maximize the vertical space which would typically be wasted in a horizontal mount, but the folding action lets you keep it from awkwardly sticking out. On top of this, is really solidly made and was super easy to install. I put it in cinderblock in less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Matt N

customer_reviews.title: Not for bikes with fenders
customer_reviews.text: Would like to return since the rack cannot be used on my cruiser bike with fenders. I was unable to get someone to install for me when purchased. Finally had a seasoned knowledgeable biker come to install for me today. He noted the bike would be unstable and scratch up both bike fenders because the design needs the tires to rest on the rack frame, and they cannot do that with the fenders. Unpacked only, not installed and original bolts/anchors in original sealed package. Would appreciate guidance on how I can return.
customer_reviews.author: NKB

customer_reviews.title: Good for clearing up space
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months and its worked well in our garage so far. It's easy enough to install, though if I could do it over I would have help with measuring the bike length. Still, it was easy enough to install by myself and has held up well. It's helped me reclaim our two-car garage by clearing up space and having our bikes mounted on the wall. I would definitely recommend this for the swiveling feature. I can push the bikes in to make room for my car, so the bikes don't sit perpendicular to the wall. It's one of the more expensive wall mounting units, but it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install and work perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: These were extremely easy to install and work awesome. I used a 3/16" drill bit to get pilot holes for the lag screws. Those use 1/2" wrench to get them secured into the wall. I mounted the top most bolt nearly tight but just enough that I can move it around to position the Steadyrack and get them vertical. Then drill and screw the bottom in place. Pop the plastic top/bottom covers back in place and the bikes go up in a flash. Got my brother one of these for christmas - hope he likes it as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: heavystarch

customer_reviews.title: Get this now if you’re looking for great storage for bikes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 months ago I think and have had my bike pulled in and out of it a ton of times but still it’s holding really well. Now one thing to note is that this product is advertised as being able to be installed anywhere but in reality it’s best to instal on a wall stud to insure it won’t fall especially if it’s for a heavy mountain bike like mine. The arm easily swings the bike with a light push and shows no signs of strain. The bottom tire holder isn’t perfectly fitting for the tires I have on however that’s not too big of a problem for me. Overall great product that is really underpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Correia

customer_reviews.title: So easy my 11 year old Daughter hang/retrieve her bike!
customer_reviews.text: Saw this in my neighbors garage and got to test drive them. They are absolutely perfect and very easy to move bikes in and out. My 11 year old has no problem putting the bike on/taking it off. They fold up when not in use too. They come w cleats for the bottom wheel but I found them not to be needed (optional). Their ability to swivel left/ride makes them easy to swing out of the way too. Staggering at slightly different heights helps so handlebars are not in the way if you hang several bikes. Designed to be mounted on wall studs however an alternative method is to hang a ledger board and mount on the board.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L.

customer_reviews.title: Passes the boss's test!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to get our bikes hanging up. Even though we have plenty of space in the garage l kept finding myself shuffling them around. Read some external reviews on bike racks which is how I came across Steadyrack. Even with imprecise measurements and having to do most of the work myself it turned out great! And even my wife can push/pull her bike on/off this rack. The tilting is just the gravy this rack needed to completely push the bike out of the way. I cannot recommend this any less than absolutely a killer rack. While more expensive than the competition the rugged build and ease of use made the Wife Acceptance Factor (WAF) make me look good!
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but very impressed.......
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for my wife's MTN Bike and mine. Install wasn't too bad. Garage studs were 16" apart so that worked perfectly. I mounted these staggered vertically so the handlebars wouldn't conflict. Ground clearance is about 1 inch for one bike and 4 inches for another. Both bikes are easy to remove and to put on the racks. The racks seem very stable and I like the fact you can move them side to side. Only downside is this set is very expensive but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The best bike rack system on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I bought ten of the regular racks and two of the fender racks to get my bikes sorted and stored in my garage. The two with the fender design are for me and my partner's commuter bikes, and the racks accept both bikes with fenders easily. I am very pleased with the Steadyrack product design, and I'm very pleased with their construction. The alternatives on the market are cheaper, but you pay for what you get and I'm glad I spent the money for this top quality product. I also find myself using the swing feature a lot more than I thought I would. This is the product I'm endorsing for all my fellow cyclists with their storage needs.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Editor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, and saves TONS of space!
customer_reviews.text: Due to being stuck inside during the Corona Virus, I have been working on re-organizing my garage. The first steps was to remove tons of old cabinets that were installed in random places. After doing this I ordered 3 of these SteadyRacks and installed them each on three consecutive studs. They are each mounted at a different height to avoid the handle bars hitting and now I have saved so much space in my garage its great. I wish I had known about these 5 years ago. If you are even debating these, do it! You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bakk

customer_reviews.title: Quality bike rack for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack made it possible for us to put ours bikes in our storage room. Excellent product, easy to install. I hesitated because our walls are drywall, no wood studs, however, after reading one of the reviewers who installed on drywall, I went for it. We used metal drywall anchors that expand and are rated for up to 100 lbs. We are very happy with this product and highly recommend it, especially for those that are tight on space.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong and worth the expense
customer_reviews.text: Pricey YES, works very well and I am very pleased with this bike hanging device. I did an actual comparison to another and despite the $$$ I prefer and see the difference in the ability and ease to use. We did have to acquire different bolts to secure for a cement wall application, but straightforward to lift bike, hang into metal framing and be able to pivot from side to side to use. It is very secure in place and two bikes (Trek) are easy to place in tandem to hang side by side but without entangling handle bars and pedals. I am purchasing another to provide a very good secure bike storage system for our bikes.
customer_reviews.author: research diva

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These were so easy to install. The only thing missing from the directions were how far apart to space multiple racks but a quick site search found the answer on their HELP section. The fact that you can swivel them to the side is awesome and an important requirement for me was that my kids can get them on and off without me. Hanging bikes from the ceiling was not going to work for that. Now in the video the little kid made it looks effortless. I will day for my daughter who is shorter it was a little bit more challenging than how they have it shown, but a little practice should fix that up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Earley

customer_reviews.title: You need a smaller drill bit than described in the manual
customer_reviews.text: This is a superior-quality product that holds your bike securely. You get your value for the price you pay for it. However, the manual recommends using a 3/8" bit to drill into your wall stud, which is too big. If you do so, your bolt won't bite. Instead, I used a 3/16" bit to drill half the length of the bolt, then ratchet the bolt in. It might take a bit more effort, but I would rather the bolt bite hard into the wood than to have it un-secured and loose.
customer_reviews.author: grassgnome

customer_reviews.title: Works correctly but quality is questionable for price
customer_reviews.text: I like these racks, but unfortunately the hardware they sent me was faulty (see image). I had to go out and buy my own hardware. Second complaint: the body of the rack is a super cheap plastic. It makes what looks like a super nice, high quality bike rack in pictures into a semi cheap looking one in real life. It’s a shame because the design of the rack itself is great. If they’d use a better plastic/other material it would be great. Instead I expect this plastic to break the first time it accidentally gets bumped by a tool. For this price I expects MUCH more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Simple to Install!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 and love it! No time to install, easy to measure out. For peace of mind, HIT A STUD in the wall. We rarely trust anchors with anything with weight. ONE ISSUE ... we were missing bolts, screws, anchor packets in 2 of the 3 sets purchased. Please send another two sets out ... pronto! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne W Jablonowski

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The bike rack is very sturdy and works just like described. I read about it on wirecutter. I used a stud finder to install it into the wood with the included hardware, rather than the drywall. The bike is heavy so I was a little worried about putting it into drywall only. Watch their installation video on the website first and you’ll be set.
customer_reviews.author: lava890

customer_reviews.title: Garage has lots of space now!
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten 5 of these to get our many bikes off of the garage floor. I love them. They are a PAIN to install (you need a drill and a socket wrench set. You need two people, too. I gave up and hired a handy person to hang them). But they look like they'll work for years. I love that they hold my shiny ruby bicycle without anything touching my paint job!
customer_reviews.author: MirandaMc

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation, space saver and easy storage of your bicycle
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for the right bike rack for a while. Wanted the family to have the ability to easily store their bicycle. This has worked very well. I looking forward to installing multiple racks to get the bikes off the ground and save space. The ability to swivel is a major space saver in my opinion. Installation was fairly easy but I would recommend mounting on a stud. As far as placing the bike on the rack it is much easier than many of the bike racks I have seen and researched. These are a little pricey in my opinion but worth it in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Teslaman

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, works perfectly for vertical bike storage. EASY on and off
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and despite the instructions, you should still pop the bike up against the wall before drilling holes and make sure it passes the eye test for height. My other racks require lifting the bike quite high and placing up on a rack. This Steadyrack is so easy my daughter can do it as you can use the wheels and physics to one's advantage.
customer_reviews.author: BrianPDX

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these and am really happy with the ease of installation and finished product. I previously had a Thule bike rack. It tipped over and damaged the hood of my wife’s car. These will definitely solve that issue, as there is ZERO chance of your bike falling out of this! Just anchor this to a stud and you’re good to go! My 1 minor complaint is the flimsy plastic piece that holds the rear bike wheel. I wish it was thicker plastic and lined with rubber pads for the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Saves space!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't follow the installation instructions and instead put my miter saw to use. I made two brackets that I drilled multiple nails into the studs in the garage and from there I drilled the Steadyrack to a plank of wood that was drilled into the brackets. For the most part easy to install, however, I will say that I wish they provided 8 of the bolts rather than just 4 for those that are paranoid like me. Easy to use and I like the swivel feature! I'd highly recommend this product if you're looking to save space in your garage!
customer_reviews.author: THan

customer_reviews.title: Nice wall rack for a bike
customer_reviews.text: It seems a good quality and clear directions. Easy to install. 4 stars because the mfg could include cement anchors at least for this price, after all it's mostly used in garages, so if you need to install on a cement wall plan on getting proper anchoring system and cement drill bit.
customer_reviews.author: bigjay850

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Racks!
customer_reviews.text: I FINALLY got the 2 I purchased installed yesterday. LOVE THEM! My wife loves that she can EASILY get her bike down and put back up and out of the way. We love the swivel ability too. I wish I had mounted them, just ever so slightly higher because I didn’t take into effect the satchel bags that are attached to the back of the bikes. Mine swipes the floor very lightly but, oh well. That’s my bad. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: PaulyK

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver in my garage!
customer_reviews.text: Our attached garage is tight on space, and I have been on a mission to really optimize wall and overhead storage so that we can park our vehicles indoors. Due to the architecture of our home, the garage has a shallow bump-out, and I took advantage of it for storage as you can see in the picture. One of the best features is how these racks can freely swing to the side so I have easy access to the ladders! I needed the fat tire version for my 29er with 2.3-inch tires, and the classic rack was perfect for my wife's bike.
customer_reviews.author: RSV

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store your bike
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these and they work great. Easy to install and saves space in a garage. I didn't like the hangers or ceiling installations as they don't look good and they can scratch the bike. These are a bit pricey but Amazon does have the best price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought this rack earlier
customer_reviews.text: Wish I bought this rack earlier! I bought this rack to save on floor space. Sounds simple and it is. I freed up some floor space, and since the bike hang on a hinge I was able to swing them to the side, almost parallel to the wall. Hardware supplied to hang the bike worked out perfect on my cement block wall. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ori Artman

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret purchasing the Steadyrack
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made. The Steadyrack is not only easy to install, but a great way to get the bikes off the ground. The bike can be turned to one side or the other by removing the bike from the bottom wheel holder. It's an awesome purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.B

customer_reviews.title: Great bike storage solution for the garage. HARDWARE FOR MOUNTING IS COMPLETE CRAP
customer_reviews.text: Very effective storage solution for the garage. I tried a bike stand for 4 bikes and it took up WAY to much room and the silicone hooks kept sliding down the tube on my mountain bikes. The included wall anchors for this rack are complete crap, don't even try to use them, it will just frustrate you. Go to a home store and get big, quality wall anchors.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the rack based on other reviews for this item. The coolest thing about this rack is its ability to swing left or right to almost lay the bike flat against the wall...seriously very cool. Very easy to install. This has nothing to do with the product but Amazon fulfillment needs to get their act together...my box arrived damaged in which the rack frame was actually sticking outside of the box. The rack was not damaged (luckily) but first impression was not good!
customer_reviews.author: Rae Marie Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution for Bike Storage!
customer_reviews.text: Love the vertical storage and the fact that you can swing the bikes towards the wall in either direction. This is a well engineered and well built piece of equipment. To the reviewer who complained about the plastic construction - that's just a cover and a good looking one at that. Look underneath & you'll see a sturdy galvanized steel frame.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good design. easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Just installed 2 of these in our small garage. Now we can store our bikes in there. The installation was easy. The instructions did not specify what size drill bit to use to drill the holes for the mounting bolts. I used a 1/4" drill bit for the large bolts that hold the main unit and a 3/16" drill bit for the small bolts that hold the tire rest. Those holes worked well. So far the racks are holding our bikes well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for packing them in
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for storing bikes in limited space. Super easy to load and unload the bikes. Make sure you mount in a stud or put up a sheet of plywood. Stagger height to really cram in a lot of bikes, otherwise handlebars will hit wheels of the next bike and will limit how close to the wall you can pivot your bikes.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and flexible use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install asside from finding properly spaced studs in my house. Dumb builders. These help make the best use of the space I have without hanging from ceiling or protruding too far and hitting the car. Might buy one more for the last little BMX bike.
customer_reviews.author: ElecEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but it's good.
customer_reviews.text: It's good quality. I staggered mine so I could maximize space, it worked well. The small tire holds to keep the back tire in place it a bad design and designed to hold the bike at a 90deg to the wall, not folding. Overall its good and I'll buy again.
customer_reviews.author: radiskull666

customer_reviews.title: Major Space Saver
customer_reviews.text: My apartment doesn't have a garage, so the only secure storage option is to bring the bikes inside. Three bikes. This took over our entire living space until I put these up. There is a bit of a trick to getting the bike in, but once you get the hang of standing it up on the back tire it's easy; if you're worried about that part watch the manufacturer's video and try it with your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Need tools to install, but once its up.... its the best
customer_reviews.text: Definitely more sturdy than the first option we picked. You definitely need a decent drill, bits and a wrench with decent torque to install it, but its pretty straight forward. The fact that it can rotate is amazing for saving space. Its also WAY easier to place the bike on it than the hook style ones. I wouldn't recommend them, they also rarely hang the bike straight. If you want the best bike hanger available at a decent price, definitely go with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Best bike rack, ever.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best bike storage option going. I love this product, and it is worth every pretty penny that Steadyrack is asking for it. I am able to store the bikes easily and can swing bikes out of the way to access one next to the other. I don't worry about wheels getting dented with hooks or damaged because the tire sits in the cradle. The mount was very easy to install (mine are installed in vertical 2X4 boards on a rack I built).
customer_reviews.author: ECF

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed having this bike rack. It was easy to install. Purchased in May of 2019 and it's been used quite a bit and it's still functioning as when it was originally installed. The left to right swing is nice to get the bike out of the way as much as possible. The plastic sounds and feels like it might crack but it has lasted so far. Can fold the frame up when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Notthemama

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent bike rack product
customer_reviews.text: Careful installation will result in an excellent long term bike storage solution. Just take your time to check for studs and to level things correctly. I bought this one used and in excellent condition from Amazon. it was in excellent condition with nothing missing and was the equivalent of a new unit with previously opened packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great bicycle rack.
customer_reviews.text: Great bicycle rack. I love that it was easy to install, it can swing left and right and sturdy. Although the racks are very well made, I wish that the plastic bezel/cover was more high quality. Even though bicycles are pretty secure, it would also be nice to have some more security to ensure bicycle cannot be lifted up or pulled off. I solved this by placing a bar through the front wheels and behind the angled part of the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Great, well made rack. Installation was pretty easy and it works great. I also ordered a fender rack and its a little tricky to get on and off. Fenders are a pain in the ass. The rack does the best it could. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. DeMaio

customer_reviews.title: Works well but.....
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I had was that black cover was plastic not thin steel. It actually shocked me, end pieces that cover steel foundation also plastic. Shabby!!! The interior steel portion solid and I kept, works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mounted three in a 48" space
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike rack design. The front wheel of the bike is set/rolled into and cradled by the rack. The extension pivots left and right and can be folded in when not in use. I mounted 3 of these in a 48" space. We keep two hybrids on the outside and a road bike in the center. They all fit nicely with some room to spare. Had tried an inexpensive hook, but did not like the way it cut into the rim/spokes where it made contact with the front wheel. The Steadyrack avoids this issue entirely. As pointed out by other reviews, the only limitation is if your bike has a front fender.
customer_reviews.author: SusanDurrett

customer_reviews.title: They work well.
customer_reviews.text: These work well. I found I needed to mount them an inch higher than they recommend. If you have fat bikes, the fat bike version is excellent and will hold a standard bike just fine. Don’t mount the rear tire support until you have the front mounted and the bike in it.
customer_reviews.author: FOH engineer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for apartment!! Space Saving and Secure
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for apartment living!! Installed 2 in my hallway and we can swing them towards the wall and walk through perfectly fine. Note: properly installed into wall studs as directed. Recommend for sure, worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Batgrrl224

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack for inside.
customer_reviews.text: It works great! It was not easy for me to install, but only because I’m not good at drilling into studs, which is a must to support a bike. I finally got it installed though and works great! I can finally get my bike out of my entry way. It’s in my walk-in closet for the winter
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great mount for small spaces.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is PERFECT for what I wanted. Installation wasnt TOO much of a hastle, as long as you have the right tools (wrench, 1/2in socket, stud finder for dry-wall or masonry drill for brick). VERY sturdy once installed and easy to rack the bick into it. There's enouch clearance to lock the bike to it if you needed. Overall a definite recommendation from me.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Steadyrack Classic
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. Packaged well and the directions are extremely easy to follow. When the bikes are up, you can leave at 90 degrees from the wall or swing them in. Really nice space saver. I have a Specialized 29er and I would recommend anyone with a bike like this to get the fat tire version. The classic is just a tad too small and very difficult to get the tire out of the rack. Oh well, not the products issue, but mine. Great rack overall.
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Kormanik

customer_reviews.title: Give a little more vertical room when installing
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say leave 50mm-75mm room on the bottom, but when I did that my bike wheel touched the floor exactly (it's supposed to float a little off the floor), so give it a little more room than the instructions suggest. Once I installed it though, it works great! I installed it on a sliver of wall that has a door on each side, and it's super easy to swing the bike back and forth to access each door.
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: If you're short with a standard bike it may be impractical to use.
customer_reviews.text: I feel this is a good rack for lighter bikes, racing bikes. It's difficult to lift a heavier bike and a bike with fenders has to sit on the fender when hanging. Mounting is a two person job in order to hold the bike and measure. Be sure to add two inches to allow space for the bottom tire holder.
customer_reviews.author: K B.

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Ingenious way to get the bikes out of the way. Much easier than trying to lift a bike to hang it. In the same space, I'd have to lift my bike to hang above my wife's, and that would be much more difficult, particularly with the vehicle next to it. These are easy for me to get both on and off, though my wife has difficulty getting hers up (I do it for her). I don't see how storing a bike could be any easier except leaving it parked on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Evil Spock

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Rack...but be weary of install instructions.
customer_reviews.text: The rack is great. Very sturdy and would recommend to anyone looking to be efficient with space in your bike storage. ONE CAVEAT - I originally followed the Imperial/US socket sizes for installation and they did not fit the bolts. Another trip to Home Depot and I tested with the metric bolt sizes which were perfect. Also, don't follow their recommendations for the bit to be used for the pilot holes. Way too big. Eyeball it yourself prior to drilling .
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Tire imprint
customer_reviews.text: I like this product but make sure you dont leave your bike on it for extended periods of time without spinning your tires or it can leave an imprint on your tires. I'll probably switch to something else that doesn't have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Massive Space Saver for an Urbanite
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Very sturdy and goes 180 degrees to the wall (my apt is teeny tiny so this was really important). Easy to get up and take down. I put it up alone, but having someone else around would have definitely made it easier. Tried to take two pictures for reference, one at 90ish degrees to the wall and one as 180 degree as possible. Sorry for the blurriness, but they represent the idea. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: hiroze

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I was leery of the price until I received the rack. It far exceeded my expectations in quality, design/functionality and ease of installation. We now have two of them.
customer_reviews.author: EBinNC

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price compared to competition
customer_reviews.text: I had the feedback sports veto hinge mounts first and they were garbage. The metal would bend and torque under the weight of my 17lb road bike which was absurd. My MTB kept ripping it out of the studs. The steady rack has changed the way I use my bikes. My fiancee is 100lbs and 5' 3" and she can mount and dismount her own road bike now because the steady rack is so easy. It is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: OkayTurkey

customer_reviews.title: Handy dandy
customer_reviews.text: Great option for us as our garage is fairly small so space is at a premium, and we didnt want to use a rack that touched the rim or carbon fiber frames of our bikes. We installed ours higher than recommended just to avoid drilling into concrete. Easy to install and get bikes in/out, definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: tknp

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and brilliant design
customer_reviews.text: Makes your bikes turn into a nice decoration on the wall. I put 2 bikes in my spare bedroom because my apartment has no room outside and I don’t want my bikes stolen. Easy to assemble and install. When I buy my next bike, I will buy another to mount it wit h the others. If you need a mount, buy this one for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not for an apartment
customer_reviews.text: Maybe if you have a small alcove, but this product really doesn't save space in an apartment at all and I was naive for thinking it would. Something that keeps your bike horizontal and closer to the wall is a much better idea. Probably works great if you have the space to put up multiple bikes next to one another in a garage but otherwise I'd avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: It gets the bike off the floor and you can easily push it out of the way with the swivel option. It also looks kind of cool with your bike hanging from the wall like that.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rack - But Amazon sent out a retunred item with a broken end cap.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 racks. All three work great but one of them was obviously a returned item, all the bolts were loose in the packaging and the plastic end cap was broken in half.
customer_reviews.author: CcubedVT

customer_reviews.title: Bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in the garage. Make sure you do the correct measurements in their instructions. It's holding up really nice. I like how you can moving the bike rack side to side. It really saves alot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Steve JS

customer_reviews.title: This rack will not support bikes with full front fenders and balloon tires.
customer_reviews.text: Warning, This bike rack will not hold bikes that have full front fenders. The fender would be pressed between the rack and the tire on the bicycle. Additionally, the tire slot is to narrow for a normal width "Beach Cruiser" bike tire. It will work for all narrow tire road and racing bicycles.
customer_reviews.author: Compuvet

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Product was an easy install, directions self explanatory. Bike rack built well. Helped get bike off the ground for more storage area. Very satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AJB

customer_reviews.title: Handiest Bike Rack out there for fat tire bikes
customer_reviews.text: This rack is great!!! It installs fairly easily, however I would recommend installing it into a stud as opposed to using the sheetrock anchors they give you in the supplied hardware. The fact that this pivots allows you to be able to swing the bike out of the way if you need a little more room to do odd and end jobs in your garage. I love it and would highly recommend it for any size bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hang and fold to the side
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but does what it says it will. Bought one of each type and now can park van in front. Love them. Side fold limited to bike handle bars
customer_reviews.author: Hoopster

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and simply the best bike racks I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and both have road and mountain bikes so for 25-years we have used racks that took of a lot of space. These genius racks take up a third of the space and are super easy to use! In my life of riding and storing bikes, I have never seen, nor used, a better solution....never! They are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: PiperFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike rack.
customer_reviews.text: Love that you don’t have to pick the whole bike up to put on this rack. As advertised, you just wheel bike forward, pick up front wheel and continue to wheel it right up into the rack. The ability for the bike to swing to either side is a superb feature. Easy to follow directions and to install. Great space saver.
customer_reviews.author: kewpie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome road bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I have a friend that owns one so I decided to get one for my road bike. Fits great and pivots easily. Installation was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Geovanny Baires

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rack. It was easy to install and I like the fact the whole front tire is held so I don't have to worry about the rim being bent and the swivel function is very convenient since our garage is very cramped.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S

customer_reviews.title: New Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy bike rack, wall mounted to studs in the garage, folds easily against wall - good feature. Note: Screws for bottom bracket are smaller diameter than main bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Dan W.

customer_reviews.title: bike storage
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this setup. The install was super easy and it appears to be very sturdy. My garage space is very small and limited and the feature that allows the bike to move from side to side is very helpful. I would recommend this bike rack and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: annette cheek

customer_reviews.title: These are worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these bike racks, they are easy to install, easy to use and well worth the money that we spent!
customer_reviews.author: Gary/Melissa

customer_reviews.title: We can now get 2 bikes and large trash can in garage!
customer_reviews.text: These bike racks are as great as advertised! We moved to a new house that has garage storage space issues. We hung these and they swivel with the touch of one finger and bikes go up and down with ease! ( My only piece of advice is that when hanging the racks add at least 2" to your total plus the extra 2" they call for. When your bike sits on the rack for the first time the rack opens more than by hand and our bikes sat on the floor. We raised them up a couple inches and then they were perfect)
customer_reviews.author: TV People

customer_reviews.title: Great storage, easy to mount and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My husband installed these in our garage and it freed up a lot of space. The racks are very sturdy, and the bikes are easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom. She loves it and likes that this does not take a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for organizing bikes! Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite bike purchases. It really helped organize my front room. Going to buy a second one to hang up next to it. Beware of low clearance tires. My Felt (all black bike pictured above) was unable to fit on this hanger. But my other two 700cc bikes fit just fine. Triathlon bikes are not good candidates for this specific model
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a great item, very good directions and it holds the ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a great item, very good directions and it holds the bike securely to the wall. I am unable to lift my bike above my head for a ceiling hook. This item allows me to lift the front tire with the rear tire on the ground and roll the bike to the hanger. With the bike on the wall it saves some floor space. Also the bike will swing toward the wall to save even more space.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Lww

customer_reviews.title: Stored and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works great and it’s very easy to load/unload the bike. Couldn’t be more satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: G_Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Well designed bike holders
customer_reviews.text: These bike holders are expensive but are extremely well thought out in their design and implementation. I bought four or them and they work exactly as explained in the manufacturer's website. Very solid construction. Relatively easy to install. Easy to roll your bike into the holder. I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: James Turner

customer_reviews.title: Basically perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these. This is the absolute best way to store bikes efficiently, but still have easy access to any of them. I have no issues giving this product 5 stars. It's basically perfect. That being said, if they offered a version that supported 2.4 to 3 inch MTB tires, without having to use fat bike version, that'd be cool.
customer_reviews.author: Adam  B

customer_reviews.title: Great rack, just needs a good fender to work with it.
customer_reviews.text: See review for the regular steady rack. Purchased two regulars and one "fender" style. The rack is great, but I am actually thinking about removing the front fender because it is kind of flimsy and you need a sturdy fender to work with this rack.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything but the price - it is very well built and works great. I love that it will swing in either direction. Probably worth paying the extra, although I will wait for a sale before buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Wandering

customer_reviews.title: Great rack but you will need some basic tools to install it
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this rack. It is a great solution if you have carbon aero wheels that do not allow you to hang the bikes by the wheel from a traditional hook. You will however need some basic tools to successfully install it like a stud finder, screw gun with drillbits, socket set or wrench, and a means to plumb the mounting screws in a vertical alignment. I think it took me about 10 or 15 minutes total to do the installation so it was quite easy.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: hard to get bike up
customer_reviews.text: This is not as easy as it looks, Getting the front wheel to hols straight while lifting is not easy. maybe be easy for a adult male but a little challenging for a female with less upper body strength. the product itself is great- strong construction and easy install.
customer_reviews.author: skbog

customer_reviews.title: Really like them
customer_reviews.text: These are so awesome!! Our garage looks cool now storing our bikes. We have road bikes, mountain bikes and e-mountain bikes on these!
customer_reviews.author: Queboduck

customer_reviews.title: Got bikes, need efficient storage, GET THESE!
customer_reviews.text: At 6+ months past installation: These are Excellent. Functionality, durability, appearance, installation, and and choice of build materials are top notch. Race bike worthy and they look well.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Bombay

customer_reviews.title: Great bike mount.
customer_reviews.text: This bike mount is amazing. It's durable, well designed, floatable, and most of all it pivots side to side. Killer for small spaces and apartments. The only con is that r leaves semi-large holes in the wall from the screws. For apartment t folks out there, they are easy to fix with some wall patch.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I do recommend tossing the included wall anchors and picking some quality ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first because of the price tag. But after I got it installed, it was well worth it! I do recommend tossing the included wall anchors and picking some quality one from the hardware store, unless you can mount directly onto a stud. The directions were clear an easy to follow and hanging your bike on this rack is as easy as they claim it is.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Darst

customer_reviews.title: Not close to the wall
customer_reviews.text: The bike can shift left or right, but it is too far from the wall. Misleading in the video, it appears to move out of the way, it does not.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Dukes

customer_reviews.title: Solid Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this mount. Had to get someone to install it in my garage, but it works great. Solid build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and design
customer_reviews.text: Steady rack is well made and unique in saving not only floor space but wall space with its swinging option .
customer_reviews.author: GQ

customer_reviews.title: Best bike rack for your home/apartment you can get
customer_reviews.text: I installed this bike racks today (three of them) and they are easy to install, use and saves tons of space. The reviews (positive ones) must be true, since what I experienced is real. My photo will show how well and easy installed they are
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: want to get organized in the garage... this works really well
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. We got this for one of our bikes and it worked so well that we purchased a second part one. It was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ckk

product_meta.title: Steadyrack Classic Bike Rack
product_meta.description: The Steadyrack Classic Bike Rack will have you thinking about new ways to store your bicycle. A perfect solution for the home, garage, small apartment or office space, the Steadyrack can store your bicycle vertically and swivel nearly 180 degrees to either side to save additional space. Built to last, the Steadyrack is easy to use and install, with no heavy lifting - simply pull your bike up on the back wheel and slide it into the rack system. And unlike bike hooks, the Steadyrack can be installed virtually anywhere. If you're tired of parking your bike in the living room, the Steadyrack Classic Bike Rack is a great alternative.Features: Can be mounted to virtually any wall Can swivel almost 180 degrees from side to side Minimizes space without compromising safety Keeps the bicycle secure without damaging the rims
feature_bullets: Fits road, hybrid and select mountain bikes with tire diameters 20” to 29” and widths up to 2.4”
Features 35kg maximum recommended weight (tested up to 80kg) , Material: Steel and UV treated plastic
Free up valuable floor space using the 160 degree side-to-side swivel, making it a convenient storage solution around parked cars and congested areas
Protects bike frame and rim from any contact with the bike rack for safe and secure storage
Easily load the bike by rolling the front tire up and into the rack without ever having to lift the bike off the ground
The rack stores flat against the wall in a closed position when not in use so that it remains accessible while out of the way
Holds bikes up to 77 lbs. on the durable steel frame while the back tire rests securely against the included tire wedge
Universal fit(Excludes some bikes with Mudguards and tire widths in excess of 85mm)

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
